com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.config

Class ConfigLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.config.ConfigLoader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultConfigLoaderListener

    public class ConfigLoader
extends Object
    A ConfigLoader is responsible for loading a web application's Stormpath configuration at application startup and making it available in the ServletContext as a Config instance. Other ServletContext aware instances loaded after this one can access the config instance by using the Config interface name as the servlet context attribute key: 
     Config config = (Config)servletContext.getAttribute(Config.class.getName());

    ConfigFactory

    The ConfigLoader will delegate config creation to a ConfigFactory instance to actually create the Config that will be made available to the application. By default, the DefaultConfigFactory implementation will be used to create the Config instance from a number of .properties file locations, system properties and environment variables.

    Custom ConfigFactory Implementation

    If you need to create a custom ConfigFactory implementation, you can implement the ConfigFactory interface yourself and specify that implementation class name as follows:

     <context-param>
     <param-name>stormpathConfigFactoryClass</param-name>
     <param-value>com.mycompany.myapp.stormpath.MyCustomConfigFactory</param-value>
 </context-param>

    And that class will be instantiated and used to create the Config instance.

    If you do not specify this context-param, com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.config.impl.DefaultConfigFactory is assumed by default.

    Since:
    1.0.RC3
    See Also:
    ConfigFactory, DefaultConfigFactory

    • Method Detail

      • createConfig

        public Config createConfig(javax.servlet.ServletContext servletContext)
                    throws IllegalStateException
        Creates and initializes a Stormpath Config instance for the web application attributed to the specified ServletContext and assigns that instance to the ServletContext for that context's lifespan. The config instance is created by instantiating a ConfigFactory implementation class, and the class name can be specified as a stormpathConfigFactoryClass context parameter. If this parameter is not specified, the default DefaultConfigFactory implementation is assumed.
        Parameters:
        servletContext - current servlet context
        Returns:
        the new Stormpath Config instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if an existing Config instance has already been initialized and associated with the specified ServletContext.

      • determineConfigFactoryClass

        protected Class<?> determineConfigFactoryClass(javax.servlet.ServletContext servletContext)
        Return the ConfigFactory implementation class to use, either the default DefaultConfigFactory or a custom class if specified.
        Parameters:
        servletContext - current servlet context
        Returns:
        the ConfigFactory implementation class to use
        See Also:
        CONFIG_FACTORY_CLASS_PARAM_NAME, DefaultConfigFactory

      • doCreateConfig

        protected Config doCreateConfig(javax.servlet.ServletContext sc)
        Instantiates a Config based on the specified ServletContext.

        This implementation determines a ConfigFactory implementation class to use. That class is instantiated, returned, and invoked.

        This allows custom ConfigFactory implementations to be specified via a ServletContext init-param if desired. If not specified, the default DefaultConfigFactory implementation will be used.

        Parameters:
        sc - current servlet context
        Returns:
        the constructed Stormpath config instance

      • destroyConfig

        public void destroyConfig(javax.servlet.ServletContext servletContext)
        Destroys the Config for the given servlet context.
        Parameters:
        servletContext - the web apps servlet context
